links: Chai Wah Wu, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..15000
mathematica: lst={};Do[p=Prime[n];If[IntegerDigits[p,8]==Reverse[IntegerDigits[p,8]],AppendTo[lst,p]],{n,7!}];lst (* _Vladimir Joseph Stephan Orlovsky_, Jul 31 2009 *)pal8Q[n_]:=Module[{c=IntegerDigits[n,8]},c==Reverse[c]]; Select[Prime[ Range[ 2000]],pal8Q] (* _Harvey P. Dale_, Dec 23 2013 *)
prog: (Python)from itertools import chainfrom sympy import isprimefrom gmpy2 import digitsA029976 = sorted((n for n in chain((int(digits(x,8)+digits(x,8)[::-1],8) for x in range(1,8**6)),(int(digits(x,8)+digits(x,8)[-2::-1],8) for x in range(1,8**6))) if isprime(n)))# _Chai Wah Wu_, Aug 16 2014(PARI) forprime(p=2,10^4, my(d=digits(p,8)); if(d==Vecrev(d),print1(p,", "))); \\ _Joerg Arndt_, Aug 17 2014
author: _Patrick De Geest_
